item.title: Virtual Functions
item.description: In C++, a virtual function is a member function of a class that can be overridden in a derived class. When a virtual function is called on a derived class object, the function of the derived class is called instead of the function of the base class. This is known as dynamic binding or runtime polymorphism. Syntax: virtual return_type functionName() { //body of the function return statement; } Suppose we have a base class named Shape and three derived classes named Circle and Rectangle and Triangle.
